name: "Guardians of the Galaxy" Chronology Part 2 Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the opening scene of the sixth episode, where were the Guardians?
options: Having dinner with the Supreme Commander.
Chained up in an enemy ship.
questions.explanation:
In a Nova Corps prison.

	The team was still searching for various crystals to use with the Crypto Cube. Their search led them to steal Nova Corps uniforms and sneak into a secure prison. Episode: "Undercover Angle"

questions.text: Which member of the team wasn't able to tell a lie?
questions.explanation:
Drax.

	Drax, or Drax the Destroyer, refused to tell a lie. He was from a warrior race and was skilled in battle. He also wasn't one of the smartest people in the world. He was willing to "act" but couldn't see when to stop acting which lead to more problems than it solved. While in the Nova Corps prison he got them attacked by prisoners when he wouldn't drop the ruse of being a guard. When he was undercover as a person who hated Nova Corps, he ended up attacking Starlord. Episode: "Undercover Angle"

questions.text: Which member of the team apparently betrayed them in the seventh episode?
questions.explanation:
Gamora.

	Gamora had been one of Thanos' top agents before she chose to turn away from evil and join the Guardians. In this episode she pretended to turn back to Thanos' side and pit his other two top agents against each other. She hadn't informed her friends of the planned deception ahead of time, though. Episode: "The Backstabbers"

questions.text: Who did the Universal Weapon belong to?
questions.explanation:
Ronan the Accuser.

	Ronan had been presumed dead prior to the animated series starting, but his Universal Weapon was still floating around in the universe. In the previous episode, the Guardians had found it. In this episode Korath, Gamora and Nebula all fought over it. Gamora wasn't really fighting to control it, but to pit her siblings against each other.  Episode: "The Backstabbers"

questions.text: What was the name of the pirate crew that Yondu was the leader of?
questions.explanation:
The Ravagers.

	Yondu and the Ravagers were the people who kidnapped Starlord from Earth when he was a child. In this episode they were fighting against the Guardians trying to steal the Crypto Cube for themselves. Episode: "Hitchin' a Ride"

questions.text: Which member of the crew got possessed by a symbiote in episode 8?
questions.explanation:
Groot.

	For the second time in the first 8 episodes Groot was overcome by an alien organism. This time he was possessed by a symbiote who forced him to attack his shipmates while they were fighting with space pirates. Episode: "Hitchin' a Ride"

questions.text: In the ninth episode Rocket ends up back on his home world. What was the name of the planet?
questions.explanation:
Half World.

	Rocket was a genetically altered creature who resembled a racoon from Earth. His planet, Half World, was the home to a testing lab where other animals were also altered. While back on his home planet, he found that most of the other animals had become sentient like he had. Episode: "We Are Family"

questions.text: While on his home world Rocket got a chance to spent time with his mother.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Rocket's mother and siblings were all still on the planet. They had become just like him and he was able to enjoy some time with them. At the end of the episode, the animals other than Rocket regressed back to their more primitive form and Rocket had to say goodbye to his family. Episode: "We Are Family"

questions.text: What was the name of the sentient moon introduced in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Mandala.

	Mandala was a full size moon, but also was a sentient being. The moon had several powers, including being able to control the minds and actions of the Guardians, making them act as they did before they got together and started working mostly for good.  Episode: "Bad Moon Rising"

questions.text: Which villain was resurrected during the tenth episode?
questions.explanation:
Ronan.

	Ronan had been presumed dead at the end of the "Guardians of the Galaxy" movie that the TV series followed. During this episode he was brought back using the powers of the living moon, Mandala.  Episode: "Bad Moon Rising"
